questions.description: Emma had been looking forward to her hiking trip for weeks. However, the night before she was supposed to leave, a severe storm warning was issued. Even though she was disappointed, she decided to postpone the trip until the weather improved.
questions.question: Why did Emma decide to postpone her hiking trip?
answer: She forgot to pack her things.

questions.description: After years of working at the same company, Mr. Thompson was finally offered a promotion. However, accepting it meant moving to another city. He spent several days thinking about it and ultimately decided to stay close to his family instead of taking the job.
questions.question: What was the main reason Mr. Thompson refused the promotion?
answer: He didn’t like the new position.
He didn’t want to move away from his family.
The salary increase was too small.
He had already accepted another offer.

questions.description: Sophia joined a photography course because she wanted to improve her skills. At first, she struggled with the technical aspects, but over time, she learned how to use lighting and composition effectively. Her final project received the highest grade in the class.
questions.question: What does the text say about Sophia’s progress?
answer: She dropped out of the course early.
She already had excellent skills before joining.
She improved significantly during the course.
She didn’t understand the lessons at all.

questions.description: When Mark arrived at the airport, he realized he had left his passport at home. His flight was scheduled to depart in just one hour. Luckily, his brother managed to bring it to him just in time, and Mark boarded the plane with only minutes to spare.
questions.question: How did Mark manage to catch his flight?
answer: He found his passport at the airport.
His brother brought his passport in time.
He didn’t need his passport after all.

questions.description: During the conference, Dr. Lewis presented her research on climate change. Many attendees were impressed by the depth of her analysis and asked her to collaborate on future projects. The success of her presentation boosted her confidence tremendously.
questions.question: What effect did the conference have on Dr. Lewis?
answer: It made her less interested in research.
It motivated her to quit her current job.
It increased her confidence and recognition.

questions.description: After losing his job, Daniel decided to start his own online business. The first few months were challenging, but he gradually gained customers through social media marketing. Within a year, his small project turned into a profitable company.
questions.question: What helped Daniel’s business become successful?
answer: A large inheritance from his uncle.
Selling his products in local stores.

questions.description: The train was delayed due to heavy snow, and passengers began to worry they would miss their connections. To ease their frustration, the staff offered free hot drinks and updates about the situation. Their calm and polite attitude helped keep everyone patient.
questions.question: How did the train staff handle the delay?
answer: They comforted passengers with drinks and updates.

questions.description: Lisa had been training for the marathon for over six months. On the day of the race, she twisted her ankle halfway through. Despite the pain, she continued running and managed to cross the finish line. Her determination inspired many people watching.
questions.question: What can be said about Lisa’s attitude?
answer: She blamed others for her injury.

questions.description: James bought an old house in the countryside and decided to renovate it himself. He watched tutorials online and learned new skills along the way. After several months of hard work, the house was transformed into a cozy and modern home.
questions.question: How did James manage to renovate his house?
answer: He followed online tutorials and worked himself.
He sold the house instead of fixing it.

questions.description: Martha volunteered at an animal shelter every weekend. She cleaned cages, fed the animals, and helped find new homes for them. One day, she adopted a dog herself, saying it was the most rewarding decision she had ever made.
questions.question: What was Martha’s motivation for adopting a dog?
answer: She felt a strong emotional connection.
She was asked by the shelter manager.

questions.question: What is the speaker planning to do next weekend?
answer: Visit a friend and go to a concert

questions.question: What is the speaker’s opinion about social media?
answer: It has both good and bad effects

questions.question: What was the protest about?
What does the speaker think about remote work?

questions.question: What does the speaker suggest about the concept of freedom?
